title-part.text: ROTARY BODIES OTHER THAN GEARING ELEMENTS

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass the following expression is used with the meaning indicated: "rotary bodies other than gearing elements" covers any element which rotates so far as its features are affected only by the fact that it rotates.

Attention is drawn to the following places:
A01B71/04 Bearings for agricultural machines
B21B31/07 Adaptation of roll bearings for metal-rolling mills
B61C17/10 Connecting-rods, bearings for driving wheels of railway locomotives
B61F15/00 Axle-boxes for railway vehicles
B62K21/06 Bearings for steering heads
E06B9/174, E06B9/50 Bearings specially adapted for roller shutters or for roller blinds
E21B10/22 Bearings for drill bits
F01C21/02 Arrangement of bearings in rotary-piston machines or engines
F01D25/16 Arrangement of bearings in non-positive displacement machines or engines
F02C7/06 Arrangement of bearings in gas-turbine plants
G01C19/16 Bearings for gyroscopes
G01D11/02 Bearings or suspensions for moving parts of measuring instruments
G01G21/02 Arrangements of bearings in weighing apparatus
G01R1/10 Arrangements of bearings in instruments for measuring electric variables
G01R11/12 Arrangements of bearings for apparatus for measuring time integral of electric power or current
G02C5/22 Hinges for spectacles
G04B31/00 Bearings for clockwork
H02N15/00 Magnetic levitation devices.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

Alloys based on nickel, e.g. Inconel
Low carbon steel, i.e. carbon content below 0.4 wt%
Medium carbon steel, i.e. carbon content from 0.4 to 0,8 wt%
High carbon steel, i.e. carbon content above 0.8 wt%, e.g. through-hardenable steel
with chromium as the next major constituent
with nickel as further constituent, e.g. stainless steel
with manganese as the next major constituent
Materials with ceramics, cermets, hard carbon or similar non-metallic hard materials as main constituents

based on ceramic carbides, e.g. silicon carbide (SiC)
Cermets, i.e. composites of ceramics and metal

Polysulphones, e.g. polysulphone [PSU], polyethersulphone [PES], polyethersulphone-block copolymer [PPSU]
Several materials as provided for in F16C2208/30 - F16C2208/54 mentioned as option
high performance polyamides, e.g. PA12, PA46
Polyethylene [PE], e.g. ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene [UHMWPE]
Composites, i.e. fibre reinforced thermosetting resins
Natural materials, i.e. based on animal or plant products such as leather, wood or cotton or extracted therefrom, e.g. lignin

reference.text: in general B22D; for plastics B29C39/00

title-part.text: by sintering pulverised material, e.g. powder metallurgy
by working of thin walled material such as sheet or tube
by extrusion, e.g. of metallic profiles
by electrical discharge or electrochemical machining
by separating parts, e.g. by severing, cracking
by sizing, by shaping to final size by small plastic deformation, e.g. by calibrating or coining

by casting molten material on the substrate
by welding, e.g. by using a laser to build a layer
by vapour deposition, e.g. PVD, CVD
by electroplating or electrolytic coating, e.g. anodising, galvanising

Linear dimensions, e.g. length, radius, thickness, gap
Crowning, e.g. crowning height or crowning radius
Osculation, i.e. relation between radii of balls and raceway groove
Degree of filling, i.e. sum of diameters of rolling elements in relation to PCD
with full complement of balls or rollers, i.e. sum of clearances less than diameter of one rolling element
General use or purpose, i.e. no use, purpose, special adaptation or modification indicated or a wide variety of uses mentioned
Large applications, e.g. bearings having an inner diameter exceeding 500 mm
related to direction with respect to gravity
Horizontal, e.g. bearings for supporting a horizontal shaft
Vertical, e.g. bearings for supporting a vertical shaft
related to environment, i.e. operating conditions
corrosive, i.e. with aggressive media or harsh conditions
low pressure, e.g. elements operating under vacuum conditions
high pressure, e.g. elements exposed to high pressure gases or fluids
Personal or domestic articles, e.g. household appliances such as washing machines, dryers
in medical appliances, e.g. in diagnosis, dentistry, instruments, prostheses, medical imaging appliances
Articles for sports, games and amusement, e.g. roller skates, toys
Apparatus used in separating or mixing
Rolling apparatus, e.g. rolling stands, rolls
Stamping, deep-drawing or punching, e.g. die sets
General build up of machine tools, e.g. spindles, slides, actuators
Hand tools, workshop equipment or manipulators
Vehicle suspensions, e.g. bearings, pivots or connecting rods used therein
Vehicle seats, e.g. in linear movable seats
Steering systems, e.g. steering rods or columns
Bicycle propulsion, e.g. crankshaft and its support
Ships, e.g. propelling shafts and bearings therefor
Cosmonautic vehicles, i.e. bearings adapted for use in outer-space
Conveyor systems, e.g. rollers or bearings therefor
Machines or articles related to building
Locks, e.g. cables to actuate door locks
Hinges, e.g. sliding bearings for hinges
Apparatus or articles in engineering in general
Toothed gear systems, e.g. support of pinion shafts
Gear shifting, change speed gear, gear box
Apparatus relating to physics, e.g. instruments
Hard disk drives or the like
Optical, e.g. movable lenses or mirrors
Dynamo-electric machines or combinations therewith, e.g. electro-motors and generators
Motor coupled with a gear, e.g. worm gears
Motor, generator coupled with a flywheel
